question.title: Will Norway qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Norway not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Norway does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Norway not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Norway does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Norway qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Norway qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Switzerland qualify as well?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:
1. Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.
2. Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

If Norway does not qualify, this question resolves as N/A. If Norway qualifies but Switzerland does not, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Conditional on Norway qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Switzerland not qualify as well?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:
1. Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.
2. Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having not qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

If Norway does not qualify, this question resolves as N/A. If Norway qualifies but Switzerland does qualify, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Conditional on Norway qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Switzerland not qualify as well?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:
1. Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.
2. Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having **not** qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

If Norway does not qualify, this question resolves as N/A. If Norway qualifies but Switzerland does qualify, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Conditional on Norway qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Switzerland qualify as well?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:
1. Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.
2. Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

If Norway does not qualify, this question resolves as N/A. If Norway qualifies but Switzerland does not qualify, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will both Norway and Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Norway and Switzerland participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Norway or Switzerland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Norway nor Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither Norway nor Switzerland participate in their respective Semi-finals or if neither is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Norway or Switzerland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Norway nor Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither Norway nor Switzerland participate in their respective Semi-finals or are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Norway or Switzerland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will either Norway or Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Norway or Switzerland participate in their respective Semi-finals or are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Norway nor Switzerland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

question.title: Given Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from any U.S. state primary ballot for federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under Russian control, indicated by categories such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any similar categories created by ISW.

Then, is the following also true on July 15, 2024: Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? This would be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024, and does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, and will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. On June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E under any of the categories indicating Russian control, such as:

   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

2. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals occurring after this date.

question.title: Conditional on the Pandemic Agreement being approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources. 

Then, will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if, before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". Additionally, Metaculus must verify that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as YES. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Given Nvidia closes below $100 per share by 7/31, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) closes below $100 per share on any day before 7/31. Then, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The market resolves to YES if NVDA closes below $100 on any day before 7/31.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be taken from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden announcing before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President for another term in the 2024 cycle. This announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Given this, will there be a debate between potential Democratic nominees (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention? Resolves YES if such a debate occurs, and NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. Resolves as No otherwise.

(2) Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?

This resolves as Yes if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves as No otherwise.

The combined question resolves as Yes if both (1) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President and (2) there is another Democratic party presidential debate. Resolves as No otherwise.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President, or will there be no other Democratic party presidential debate?
not_P.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must leave room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. Resolves as No otherwise.

(2) Will there be no other Democratic party presidential debate?

This resolves as Yes if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves as No otherwise.

The combined question resolves as Yes if either (1) Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President or (2) there is no other Democratic party presidential debate. Resolves as No otherwise.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President, or will there be no other Democratic party presidential debate?
not_P.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement that he will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. Resolves as No otherwise.

(2) Will there be no other Democratic party presidential debate?

This resolves as Yes if there is not a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves as No otherwise.

The combined question resolves as Yes if either (1) Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President or (2) there is no other Democratic party presidential debate. Resolves as No otherwise.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President, and will there be other Democratic party presidential debates?
not_P.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. Resolves as No otherwise.

(2) Will there be other Democratic party presidential debates?

This resolves as Yes if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves as No otherwise.

The combined question resolves as Yes if both (1) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President and (2) there are other Democratic party presidential debates. Resolves as No otherwise.

question.body:
Suppose the following is true: "House of the Dragon" S2E7 (title TBA) is rated greater than 8.5 on IMDB two days after its release, based on the score displayed on July 30th at noon PT. This is a strict inequality, and the precision listed by IMDB is typically a single decimal. The current IMDB ratings for previous episodes are provided for context.

Given this, will the market linked in the question have at least 377 traders by the end of July 15? The market resolves YES if the embedded market has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time), and NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Google DeepMind publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

not_P.title: Will Google DeepMind not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
not_P.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

not_P.title: Will Google DeepMind not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
not_P.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

not_P.title: Will Google DeepMind publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
not_P.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Conditional on Google DeepMind publishing a report with results from external red-teaming by June 30, 2024, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the EU on that date?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By June 30, 2024, Google DeepMind publishes a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. Given this, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if Google DeepMind publishes a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as YES if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, meaning that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. It still resolves positively if unavailable in certain EU countries or to certain groups, as long as >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and resolves positively if the name or website has changed but the service remains substantially the same.

not_P.title: Conditional on Google DeepMind not publishing a report with results from external red-teaming by June 30, 2024, will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the EU on that date?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: By June 30, 2024, Google DeepMind does not publish a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. Given this, will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if Google DeepMind does not publish a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as YES if ChatGPT is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, meaning that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. It still resolves positively if available in certain EU countries or to certain groups, as long as ≤50% of the population cannot use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and resolves positively if the name or website has changed but the service remains substantially the same.

not_P.title: Conditional on Google DeepMind publishing a report with results from external red-teaming by June 30, 2024, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the EU on that date?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: By June 30, 2024, Google DeepMind publishes a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. Given this, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if Google DeepMind publishes a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as YES if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, meaning that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly without requiring payment. It still resolves positively if available in all EU countries or to all groups, as long as >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and resolves positively if the name or website has changed but the service remains substantially the same.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union?
question.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Google DeepMind does not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, nor (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is not generally available in the European Union?
not_P.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Not generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If available in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or available to (for example) minors, this will still resolve negatively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump’s lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will Biden have a 45+ minute in-person interview before end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by accessing the national polling average chart on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024? 

For Biden's interview to count, it must be an in-person interview with at least 45 minutes of new footage of him being interviewed. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., do not count. Appearances on podcasts, late-night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 Minutes do qualify, provided there is at least 45 minutes of interview footage. If no such interview is released by the end of July, the outcome is NO.

not_P.title: Given Trump’s lead over Biden is not greater than 2 or not less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will Biden not have a 45+ minute in-person interview before end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is not greater than 2 or not less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by accessing the national polling average chart on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will not have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024? 

For Biden's interview to not count, it must be that there is no in-person interview with at least 45 minutes of new footage of him being interviewed. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., do not count. Appearances on podcasts, late-night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 Minutes do qualify, provided there is at least 45 minutes of interview footage. If such an interview is released by the end of July, the outcome is YES.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Conditional on the ICC issuing arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court issues an arrest warrant for any of the following Israeli leaders: Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi. Then, will a terrorist attack occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if the ICC issues a warrant of arrest for any of the listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as Yes if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The attack must be described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. The question resolves as No if the above does not happen.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Will Hurd being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If this condition is met, we then inquire whether credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. 

Resolution criterion for the condition: Resolves **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee. Resolves **No** otherwise.

Resolution criterion for the outcome: Resolves **Yes** if credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified at the trial, whether in person or remotely. Resolves **No** otherwise.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Malta not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024?

Resolves No if Donald Trump has a higher probability. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, resolves 50-50. The resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast.

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Francis Suarez being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between the Republican and Democratic nomination processes for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Condition: Francis Suarez must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Outcome: The question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to not invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

not_P.body:

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland not to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: If Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will he announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before August 2024, the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that Biden is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office, causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President. Note that Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., or invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count.

Then, will Joe Biden or his campaign make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle? To resolve as Yes, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of accepting the nomination.

Then, will Joe Biden or his campaign make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will seek and will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle? To resolve as Yes, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of not accepting the nomination.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 and (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President: This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model. This resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

(b) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also meet this condition. If these criteria are not met by market close, this condition is not met.

question.title: Given the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee is a Woman, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Then, consider the following: Will the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics? This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different NOCs win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as Yes.

question.title: Given a Trump family member is the Republican nominee in 2024, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A member of the Trump family becomes the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This includes Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

Then, will Donald Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat? There are two Manifold polls that close on July 6. One poll asks respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat. This question resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the poll with Joe Biden exceeds that in the poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 minus the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland not to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Given Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will 538 project him as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This means the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) have invoked Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024? This will resolve to “Yes” if Biden is projected as more likely to win than Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's forecast. It will resolve to “No” if Trump is projected as more likely to win. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this will resolve 50-50. The resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024.

not_P.title: Given Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will 538 not project him as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This means the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) have invoked Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will not have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024? This will resolve to “Yes” if Biden is projected as less likely to win than Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's forecast. It will resolve to “No” if Trump is projected as less likely to win. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this will resolve 50-50. The resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, and (b) 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.
(b) 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024: This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market. This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19. Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Given 538 Projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is projected as the favorite over Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast, meaning he has a higher probability of winning than Trump based on the trend lines for that date.

Resolution criteria for the condition (P): This resolves to "Yes" if Biden has a higher probability of winning than Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's forecast for July 19, 2024. It resolves to "No" if Trump has a higher probability. If they have equal odds, it resolves 50-50.

Now, given this condition, consider the outcome: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 according to FiveThirtyEight's national polling average on July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q): This resolves "Yes" if Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points as reported on the FiveThirtyEight national polling average chart for July 15, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. For example, a value of 2.4 means Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden.

(a) Joe Biden will have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19. The resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 2 or less than or equal to 4 in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden still being president by the end of July, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between Joe Biden's status as president and the opposition within his party to an early nomination plan.

Condition: Joe Biden must still be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

Outcome of interest: Resolves YES if at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures also suffice. Resolves NO if these criteria are not met by market close.

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump testifying at the hush money trial, will Iran initiate military action before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This question explores the potential correlation between two seemingly unrelated events: Donald Trump testifying at his trial concerning "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, and Iran initiating military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory.

Criterion for condition: Credible sources must report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the specified trial.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, as officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions, but excludes cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions. Only actions explicitly claimed by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory count. Proxy force actions do not count.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial? (b) Will Iran initiate a military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

(b) This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Conditional on Trump gaining at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This question resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO.

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

Suppose the following is true: The percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. Then, will a group of at least 5 named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?

(1) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(2) This market resolves YES if a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.body: If Biden drops out or is unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

question.title: Given Biden drops out before July 20, will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, will Mike Pence be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for P: Resolves YES if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Otherwise, resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for Q: Resolves YES if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO.

question.title: Conditional on Elon Musk attending Bitcoin Nashville 2024, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This market will resolve YES, if Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.

Suppose the following is true: Elon Musk shows up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024.

Then, will Donald Trump be officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for Trump removal: The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question resolves as "Yes" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024, and "No" if they are not.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Elon Musk appears on stage at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 (b) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

The question will resolve as NO if either condition (a) or (b) is not met.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's on June 28th, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average. The value is reported as positive for a Trump lead and negative for a Biden lead, and this is verified on July 17, 2024.

Then, is it true that on June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's according to Companies Market Cap, as checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC)?

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: If Greens–EFA holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

Then, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024? The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined, given "Twisters" (2024) is "Certified Fresh"?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: "Twisters" (2024) has a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75% one week after its release, as displayed on its Rotten Tomatoes page. This score is used to determine if the movie is "Certified Fresh" for the purposes of this question.

Given this condition, will the domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than $185,548,391? This resolves as Yes if the domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" reported by Boxofficemojo is higher than the combined opening of "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013), which is $185,548,391. If "Twisters" does not achieve a score of at least 75% on Rotten Tomatoes, the condition is not met and this question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).
