question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will Biden not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through the end of July 2024. 

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will Biden not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President until then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Given Joe Biden has an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera lasting at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, or rallies, but can include appearances on a podcast, late night show, or interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

Then, is it also true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? This is determined by the reported value on 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Given an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥21 gold medals?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. This means any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Then, is it true that Individual Neutral Athletes will collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, according to the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources. Otherwise, it resolves to "No". If confirmed before the end of the Games that they have won 21 or more gold medals, it resolves immediately to "Yes".

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

(a) At least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources.

The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan and will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
1. Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early? 

Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

2. Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?

This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

This combined question resolves as YES if both of the following occur: (1) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, and (2) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Ted Cruz is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Suppose Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This question resolves as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is indeed the nominee, as determined by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Given this scenario, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model? Specifically, the question resolves **Yes** if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. It resolves **No** otherwise.

Link to model: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.body:

1. Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Switzerland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Switzerland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Switzerland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Switzerland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Switzerland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Portugal qualify as well?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Portugal participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

not_P.title: Given Switzerland does not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Portugal not qualify as well?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Ted Cruz is selected, this question will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: If Ted Cruz is the Republican nominee, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024? This will be assessed based on the chart for July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

question.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: If ISS advises against Musk's package or re-election, will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for 2024?
question.body:
The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise, the question will resolve as **No**.

Suppose the above condition is true. Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

not_P.title: Will the Crimean Bridge not be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, there are no [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) reporting that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

not_P.title: Will the Crimean Bridge not be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, there are no [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) reporting that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

not_P.title: Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, there are credible sources reporting that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

question.title: Given the Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024, will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge. Then, is it true that Joe Biden will still be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024?

not_P.title: Given the Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024, will Joe Biden not be president by the end of July?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge. Then, is it true that Joe Biden will not be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024?

not_P.title: Given the Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024, will Joe Biden not be president by the end of July?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge. Then, is it true that Joe Biden will not be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024?

not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge. Then, is it true that Joe Biden will be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden is still president by the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge; and (2) At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

not_P.title: Will either of the following not occur: (a) The Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024, or (b) Joe Biden is not president by the end of July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (1) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) do not report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge; or (2) At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is not officially president of the United States.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (a) The Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024, or (b) Joe Biden is not president by the end of July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (1) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has not been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge; or (2) At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is not officially president of the United States.

not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden is president by the end of July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge; and (2) At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is officially president of the United States.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to not invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker does not ask Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

not_P.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker does ask Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: If Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will the ICC issue arrest warrants for any listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This occurs if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Then, is it true that before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) will issue a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)? It resolves as Yes if such a warrant is issued before July 1, 2024, and No otherwise.

not_P.title: If Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will the ICC not issue arrest warrants for any listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This occurs if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Then, is it true that before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) will not issue a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)? It resolves as Yes if no such warrant is issued before July 1, 2024, and No otherwise.

not_P.title: If Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will the ICC not issue arrest warrants for any listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This occurs if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Then, is it true that before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) will not issue a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)? It resolves as Yes if no such warrant is issued before July 1, 2024, and No otherwise.

not_P.title: If Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will the ICC issue arrest warrants for any listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This occurs if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Then, is it true that before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) will issue a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)? It resolves as Yes if any such warrant is issued before July 1, 2024, and No otherwise.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 and (b) the ICC issue arrest warrants for any listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) This question will resolve as **No** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not issue a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **Yes** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 nor (b) the ICC issue arrest warrants for any listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

question.title: Given Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden makes a definitive, public, and official announcement before July 15, 2024, that he will not seek or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. This announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of accepting the nomination.

Then, is it true that Chris Christie will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The resolution for this question is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.body:

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not announce that he is either dropping out or resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden does not announce either that he is no longer running for re-election or that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must not occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. An announcement of his intention to do either is sufficient to resolve this market as NO.

Otherwise, this market resolves YES on August 1st.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not announce that he is either dropping out or resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden does not announce either that he is no longer running for re-election or that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must not occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. An announcement of his intention to do neither is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is either dropping out or resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces either that he is no longer running for re-election or that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. An announcement of his intention to do either is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

question.title: If Joe Biden announces he is dropping out and resigning before the end of July, will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will resign from the presidency before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. This means he announces his intention to not complete his current term and to drop out of the race. Note that he does not have to have formally resigned by the end of July, just announced his intention to do so. Given this, will Donald Trump be charged or indicted for witness tampering related to potential witnesses in the case *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024? The indictment must occur before June 1, 2024 for the resolution to be YES.

not_P.title: If Joe Biden does not announce he is dropping out and resigning before the end of July, will Donald Trump not be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden does not announce both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will resign from the presidency before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. This means he does not announce his intention to not complete his current term and to drop out of the race. Note that he does not have to have formally resigned by the end of July, just announced his intention to do so. Given this, will Donald Trump not be charged or indicted for witness tampering related to potential witnesses in the case *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024? The indictment must occur before June 1, 2024 for the resolution to be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces he is dropping out and resigning before the end of July 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this component.

(b) Resolves YES if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

The combined question resolves YES if both (a) and (b) occur as described.

question.title: If Kamala Harris is President by Friday, will 20 Democrats oppose early Biden nomination?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this event will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Then, in this scenario, will at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate President Joe Biden early? This resolves YES if such a letter is signed by at least 20 lawmakers before the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures also count. If these criteria are not met by market close, this resolves NO.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is NO if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is YES.

(b) The two favorites for Kamala’s running mate are currently Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. It is reported, Kamala will choose before August 7th. This market resolves YES if/when Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. This market resolves NO if/when Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate. The pick must be confirmed by Kamala herself to resolve this.

question.title: Conditional on Nikki Haley being the Republican nominee, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
This question explores the potential political dynamics if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution criterion for this condition is that Nikki Haley must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee.

Given this scenario, the outcome we are interested in is whether the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) will invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that President Biden is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office, thereby making the Vice President serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). It does not matter how long the incapacity lasts for this question to resolve as YES.

It should be noted that Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count for this question. The context involves discussions around the potential invocation of the 25th Amendment as raised by a GOP lawmaker.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden having an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024. This includes appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there are at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. It does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? This will resolve as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. It will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, and (2) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
(1) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, excluding press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. The interview must be released before the end of July 2024. Qualifying appearances include podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes, with at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. 

(2) Donald Trump must be officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice. The resolution does not account for legal battles, appeals, or reversals after July 15, 2024.

(2) Donald Trump must not be officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This must not be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.
